shows.title: Ghost Trees
shows.desc:
This is a talk about connections: in time, in space, with other species and in community. Illustrated by stories, Bob explores the importance of attentiveness in observing nature, understanding our history and appreciating the local.

Bob Gilbert is an author, broadcaster and campaigner for conservation. His latest book Ghost Trees is longlisted for the Wainwright Prize.

shows.title: Looking for the Overlooked
shows.desc:
'Attentiveness is love' according to theologian John Main. This is a walk about 'looking for the overlooked'; the weed on a wall, the trodden plant on a path, the lichen on tree bark, and about their stories.

Bob Gilbert is an author, broadcaster and campaigner for conservation. His latest book Ghost Trees is longlisted for the Wainwright Prize.
